description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ei26","text":"A protocol for the detection of insect-associated Serratia spp. in the frass of live insects, using a LAMP assay targeting the ureD gene of urease-positive species from the Serratia marcescens complex. In order to improve the DNA extraction from folivorous insects a bacterial separation and concentration protocol has been developed prior to the DNA extraction, but this part of the protocol is not required for carnivorous and omnivorous insects. To improve accuracy the LAMP assay is conducted in triplicate, and a pH-linked calorimetric assay changes from pink to yellow for positive results. This protocol is potentially suitable for field applications with minimal equipment required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":127,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":173,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"apltk","text":"Collect   fresh   per DNA extraction and store at   until processing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":16,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2mb2a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"65pmp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es48p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5509c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"37B56FB0F53611ED8A3E575DE9D30A4F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A86A95F0F53611ED8A3E575DE9D30A4F","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eeipc","text":"This protocol has been developed for folivorous insects such as phasmids and larval lepidopterans. Carnivorous and omnivorous insects are not likely to require bacterial separation and concentration, so the protocol can commence with 300 mg of crude frass added directly to the PowerBeads tube (Step 13) in the DNA Extraction section.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnf0g","text":"The following protocol is for one pooled frass sample and one DNA extraction. Scale up as required. You may choose to do one or more DNA extractions for each pooled frass sample.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"440d","text":"If you conduct multiple extractions on one pooled sample, you may use the same surface, forceps and pestle without sterilising between.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3m36q","text":"Make up stock solutions of the LAMP primers using MG H20. Add the same amount of MG H20 to the dried primers as the primer amount in moles to make   stock solutions. {"blocks":[{"key":"berk8","text":"Tip out   onto a sterile surface (e.g. parafilm or petri dish) and using sterile forceps add approximately   frass (for D.australis approximately 2 adult, 8 subadult or 17 juvenile frass pieces) to each of five   microcentrifuge tubes (  total).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":120,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":107,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":211,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":236,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpoju","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e9va0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47h2v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aeh4p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"sample","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":null,"entityMap":null}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"60","error":false,"guid":"8B7A95002DD311EE944B711D58183EFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1.5","error":false,"guid":"929176602DD311EE944B711D58183EFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"9E68ED102DD311EE944B711D58183EFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":308,"style":"italic"},{"length":13,"offset":421,"style":"italic"}],"key":"fgc2t","text":"Different life stages of insect produce frass pieces of significantly different sizes. For maximum accuracy count the frass pieces in 1 gram of your pooled sample, then calculate the average mass / frass peice and calculate the number of frass peices in 60 mg. We previously calculated that frass from adult D. australis is approximately 30 mg/piece, from subadults 8 mg/piece, and juveniles 3.6 mg/peice. Therefore, for D. australis you can use the above estimates for 60 mg frass added to each microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"5":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"73vtv","text":"If using reusable forceps disinfect them between each of the pooled frass samples you are testing. We generally scrubbed with Virkon if there was gross contamination, then rinsed with tap water, dried, and sterilised with 70-80% ethanol and flame.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2krpl","text":"Using one sterile pestle for each pooled frass sample crush the   in each tube until well homogenised in the PBS. {"blocks":[{"key":"5bmhl","text":"At the end of the 30 min incubation, the results of the LAMP assays can be interpreted and photographed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mg21","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fd9e9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4j7m1","text":"Yellow = Positive","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7ccbg","text":"Pink = Negative","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d2m5j","text":"Orange = Inconclusive","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cphdl","text":"The LAMP products can be stored at   for several months, but over time the amplification products will break down, affecting the pH and changing the colour. If left at   the products will break down and cause colour change much faster.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":168,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"conn1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cilov","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CF7F4B402DE911EE944B711D58183EFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"DA15DD802DE911EE944B711D58183EFA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"886gi","text":"Any opening of the tubes containing LAMP products (i.e. to run on an agarose gel) should be done with caution, as the very high yield of amplification products by LAMP can easily contaminate a workspace with LAMP products.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
